body.p: The following list summaries the qualified configurations and their purpose.
Note: While the hardware requirements are similar to those of HP Helion OpenStack 1.1, this is a completely new instsallation, not an upgrade or update operation.

ul.li: Single control plane for all control plane services
Network traffic separation providing for different services on different VLANs
Multiple server roles for different services (Compute, Object etc) with different disk configuration options

li.p: Scaled down example, optimized for reduced server count
Cloud controllers (minimum of 3 nodes for database quorum)

ul.li: Neutron network services (centralized routers, DHCP, metadata, default SNAT, VPN agent)
Everything else: MySQL, RabbitMQ, API, Other Services

body.p: VSA Cluster (min 1 node, no HA) - or use 3PAR
6 with VSA (deployer + 3 control plane + compute + VSA)
Controller (shared by all control plane servers), Compute, VSA
A dedicated network for IPMI/iLO must be connected to all the nodes
Dedicated NIC for operating system installation and Ansible

ul.li: configured as part of os-deploy, used by Ansible, not further configured by HLM
This restriction will be removed in a future release
Bond0: Management, External API, External VMs, Vxlan, Provider VLANs

body.p: Each network is a single L3 segment
Load balancers are provided by haproxy
TLS only on external API, using customer supplied certificate
VLAN IDs and IP addressing provided by customer
All servers assume single OS “disc” protected by RAID controller (to be set up by customer before os-deploy)
Compute Node adds one additional disc and LV for Nova (customer can add other discs following this pattern)
VSA adds one additional disc dedicated to VSA (customer can add other discs following this pattern)
Controller adds one additional disc dedicated to object storage (customer can add other discs following this pattern)
